job_title: Data Entry Clerk in Anaheim, CA

review_title: This place has potential to be a great hospital but changes need to be made
pros: It’s a small, old hospital but the nursing staff are truly there for the patients. People are very helpful and work as a team. Small hospital so everyone gets to know each other. They promote further education and pay you to do some classes. FlexEd classes are free for staff. There’s a clinical shift manager on both days and nights unless the unit is short. Free benefits - decent benefits as long as you’re not admitted to a hospital. Parking is free. Shift Hours are 6 am to 6:30pm for day shift.
cons: Pay could be a lot better. Smaller hospital often means more gossip and more drama. People often speak their native language when it’s supposed to be English in care areas. No union and it’s a private hospital. Computer system is old and slow. Lack of resources- old equipment, shared equipment between units, no intensive care doctor or hospitalist in the hospital at all times, no residents, doctors rarely do their own consults. Often short staffed. CNA’s are only provided for some units. Only one central supply staff at night to supply the whole hospital and minimal EVS staff at night. 30 minute breaks only in a 12-hour shift. No break nurse. Everyone is overworked. Vacation and sick time are combined so if you’re sick you’re using vacation time.

pros: Great team dynamic, coworkers are nice
cons: Limited resources, older technology, short staff

pros: Tight-knit small hospital. Most coworkers are amazing. Free insurance.
cons: Budget-crazed administration and managers. There is so much turnover with managers and nurses.

review_title: You only work here because the staff
job_title: Parkview Community Hospital in Riverside, CA
pros: Great learning hospital, staff is very nice
cons: Short staffed, never get breaks, workload is very high, management needs work

pros: the ER staff is family
cons: The ER staff is also clicky

pros: Some very good nurses, hire mostly new grads, hire ADN
cons: Nurses get a little experience and quit. Admits can be 2 at once. Charge nurses do not know how to help on the floor so don't. Some of the MDs just hate nurses and will not talk to them. Many heroin addicts and homeless patients. Corporation takes away benefits, actually took medications away from insurance coverage until so many people quit that they put them back. Pay is substandard. Terribly understaffed and managers flex people anyway. Filthy, old med surg tower unit. Computer system (CPSI) is hopelessly complicated. There is nothing to keep nurses here.

review_title: This hospital has awesome staff with a lot of promise for advancement in the future
pros: The staff are awesome. I've floated to several different departments, and I have always been welcomed warmly. Everyone is willing to help you out! They are working hard to advance themselves. They have been certified on the Pathway to Excellence for Magnet Designation. I see a lot of promise for this hospital in the future.
cons: ARMC is a small community hospital, so it is still working on advancing many medical processes. The EMR is fully functional, but is slow and cumbersome. Although I do see a lot of promise with this hospital in the future, they do have a long way to go. Financial limitations are a large factor and older/experienced staff hesitation to change.

pros: I love helping people specially when my type of work environment is all about that, my MD would always get me to learn new things. Work flow always went excellent don't have to put up with much as other MD offices.
cons: I never see work as competition with other employees, however other may see it that way so always try to keep your ego strong and do not let others affect your work ethic.

job_title: Unit Secretary/Monitor Tech in Anaheim, CA
pros: Decent hospital, most management is very nice but night shift has the best managers. Pay is very good. Raises are very impressive as well. Lots of staff become your friends. Relaxed work environment.
cons: Unprofessional staff with no consequences, hardly offer overtime, flex hours occasionally, high turnover rate. Lots of staff from other countries and tend to talk in other languages so people get left out and sometimes bully people. Short staffed. Hard to get supplies from other departments.

pros: The employees are incredible to work with. Great teamwork in the unit, especially when things get hectic.  Better than most of the local hospitals.
cons: Faulty equipment, CPSI system is outdated/frustrating, management does not look out for you.

pros: My coworkers are awesome. Everyone is really helpful especially if you’re a new grad. It started to feel like home right off the bat.
cons: Benefits aren’t that great and ER is a mess. We lack resources and the charting system is not up to par with most hospitals.
